npcText: George: Wha-? Oh you mean this? Here

playerText: Your eyes seem quite cloudy. Are you okay?
npcText: George: My vision isn't quite what its used to be. I feel like I'm seeing things. That's an angel behind you, is it not? Oh, and I also feel quite stiff.
I was asleep in the park. Next thing I knew I woke up in the station, ticket in hand. The the train was in front of me, so I got on.
Not quite sure. My ticket says 'Llih Dleiftah' but I haven't a clue as to what that means.

playerText: I see. Thank you sir. Your ticket is valid. You're headed for Hatfield.
npcText: Alright then, thanks. I can't quite remember why I'm going there, I think its to see my wife again. She died many years ago, and she was buried in Hatfield.

playerText: Your ticket was bought by an 'Anna Smith' about 18 years ago. Does that name ring a bell?
npcText: Yes, yes that quite does. That's my wife. She told me about how the ticket would lead me back to her again. Maybe this is what she meant.

playerText: I hope you do see her again.
npcText: I do too. I need to thank her for getting me a ticket for a train pulled by the last ever 6000 class locomotive. Its my favourite.
